N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 567.7 - Selection process

State Regulations
(a) An agency
review committee, consisting generally of three to five individuals appointed
by the agency head, shall evaluate all nominations in an objective manner and
shall make recommendations to the agency head regarding selection of award
recipients and determination of award amounts. In particular, every effort
shall be made to consider employees at all M/C levels and in all agency offices
and facilities. The committee may request further information regarding the
achievement before making an award determination. (b) Awards must be based upon demonstrable
records of achievement. The considerations, criteria, and reasons for a
decision to make or not to make an award should be communicated by the
committee to the agency head, who shall make the final determination as to the
number of awards and the dollar value of each. (c) There is no appeal from an award decision
by the agency head; nominations may, however, be resubmitted in the following
year(s), if they continue to meet eligibility criteria. (d) GOER will not participate in the
selection process, but will provide overall direction and evaluation of the
program. Notes
